column2: Hong Kong watchdog fines JP Morgan for control
column4: Dec 15 Hong Kong's securities watchdog has fined U.S. bank JP Morgan HK$30 million ($3.87 million) for systems and control failings in its institutional equities business in Hong Kong
column5: in one of the largest fines ever levied by the watchdog.

column2: U.S. GAO dismisses Lockheed's protest of $6.75 bln Army contract to OshkoshU.S. GAO dismisses Lockheed protest of $6.75 bln Oshkosh Army dealUPDATE 2-U.S. GAO dismisses Lockheed protest of $6.75 bln Oshkosh Army dealU.S. GAO dismisses Lockheed protest of $6.75 bln Oshkosh Army deal WASHINGTON The U.S. Government Accountability Office on Tuesday dismissed Lockheed Martin Corp's  protest of a $6.75 billion Army contract for next-generation Humvees to Oshkosh  after Lockheed said it would take the issue to federal court.  U.S. GAO dismisses Lockheed protest of $6.75 bln Oshkosh Army deal WASHINGTON The U.S. Government Accountability Office on Tuesday dismissed Lockheed Martin Corp's  protest of a $6.75 billion Army contract for next-generation Humvees to Oshkosh  after Lockheed said it would take the issue to federal court. column2: FDA approves Merck drug to reverse effects of muscle relaxants Dec 15 Merck & Co Inc.'s drug to reverse the effects of muscle relaxants used during surgery has won U.S. approval.

column2: Early praise for Star Wars awakens the Force in shares of Disney
column4: Dec 15 Early praise for the newest installment of "Star Wars" gave a boost to shares of Walt Disney and Electronic Arts
column5: which recently launched a videogame based on the hugely popular space opera.

column2: Yahoo Japan offers to buy travel site Ikyu for $828 mlnYahoo Japan offers to buy travel site Ikyu for $828 million Yahoo Japan said it offered to take over travel website Ikyu Corp for around 100 billion yen ($828 million)
column3: as the Japan-based e-commerce company aims to expand its travel and restaurant reservation business.  Yahoo Japan offers to buy travel site Ikyu for $828 million Yahoo Japan said it offered to take over travel website Ikyu Corp for around 100 billion yen ($828 million)
